meanings.definition: One who asserts or makes a claim.
meanings.sent1: The assertor confidently stated his opinion during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The assertor in the debate made a strong argument for his position.
meanings.sent3: The assertor at the party claimed to have seen a UFO last night.
meanings.sent4: She was the assertor of the family, always speaking up for what she believed in.
meanings.sent5: The assertor's voice echoed through the courtroom as he presented his case.

meanings.definition: To state or declare positively and often forcefully or aggressively.
meanings.sent1: He will assertor his authority as the team leader.
meanings.sent2: She tends to assertor her opinions without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to assertor its dominance over the new puppy.
meanings.sent4: The waves assertor their power as they crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to assertor control over the noisy classroom.
